information: Jay Jones has secured endorsements from several high-profile Virginia Democrats, including former Governors Terry McAuliffe and Ralph Northam, as well as U.S. Representative Bobby Scott. Shannon Taylor's endorsements include support from the Fairfax County Commonwealth's Attorney and some former attorneys general. The winner of the primary will face the incumbent Republican, Jason Miyares, in the general election.

forecast.status_quo_outcome: Jerrauld 'Jay' Jones wins a competitive primary. His superior fundraising and high-profile endorsements from the Democratic party establishment provide a crucial edge in mobilizing voters.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Shannon Taylor's message as an experienced prosecutor resonates more strongly with primary voters in the final weeks, and her get-out-the-vote operation in key localities like Henrico and Fairfax counties proves more effective, allowing her to overcome Jones's establishment backing.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Jay Jones successfully leverages his significant endorsements from figures like former Governors McAuliffe and Northam to consolidate party support and drive turnout, particularly in his Hampton Roads base, securing a clear victory in the Democratic primary.
forecast.rationale:
My forecast of 62% is based on Jay Jones's position as the likely, but not certain, favorite in this primary. The primary is only two weeks away, so campaign fundamentals are largely set. Jones's primary assets are his previous statewide run in 2021, which built name recognition and a campaign infrastructure, and his formidable endorsements from the core of the Virginia Democratic establishment, including former Governors McAuliffe and Northam and Rep. Bobby Scott. In a typically low-turnout primary, such establishment backing is a powerful indicator of organizational and fundraising strength, which is critical for get-out-the-vote efforts. 

My probability is not higher because Shannon Taylor is a credible opponent. As the Commonwealth's Attorney for populous Henrico County and with endorsements from law enforcement figures, she presents a strong profile that can appeal to moderate Democratic voters. The absence of reliable public polling in this race introduces significant uncertainty, and a late surge in support for Taylor cannot be ruled out. A probability above 70% would understate the competitiveness of the race. 

My probability is not lower because the weight of Jones's endorsements is difficult to overstate. It signals a coalescing of the party around his candidacy, making him the status quo choice. Betting against such a unified party front is statistically a poor choice. A probability below 50% would incorrectly position him as the underdog. 

I would increase my forecast if late polling showed Jones with a comfortable lead. I would decrease it if polling indicated a toss-up or a Taylor lead, or if Taylor secured a last-minute, high-impact endorsement.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Jerrauld "Jay" Jones win the Democratic primary for attorney general of Virginia in the 2025 election?

Question background:
Washington Post: [Former Del. Jay Jones (D) of Norfolk ramps up bid for Virginia AG](https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2024/11/12/virginia-jones-miyares-ag-election/)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if [Jerrauld "Jay" Jones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jay_Jones_(politician)) wins the 2025 Democratic primary for Attorney General of Virginia, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).

The Democratic primary election is currently scheduled for June 17, 2025. If there is no Democratic primary held before June 30, 2025, the question will be **annulled**.


Your research assistant's report says:
Jay Jones has secured endorsements from several high-profile Virginia Democrats, including former Governors Terry McAuliffe and Ralph Northam, as well as U.S. Representative Bobby Scott. Shannon Taylor's endorsements include support from the Fairfax County Commonwealth's Attorney and some former attorneys general. The winner of the primary will face the incumbent Republican, Jason Miyares, in the general election.

Today is 2025-06-03.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
